newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Carpetmaker Associated Weavers seeks stock listing.
newsitem.headline: Carpetmaker Associated Weavers seeks stock listing.

text.p: Belgian carpet maker Associated Weavers International said on Monday it was seeking a listing on the Brussels bourse later this year.
It said the listing would enable it to broaden its shareholdership and continue its international expansion strategy.
The operation will be managed by Banque Degroof and Generale Bank in cooperation with KB-Securities.
Associated Weavers, based in Renaix, exports 98 percent of its output, mainly in Europe, the U.S. and the Far East.
It said its sales volume of tufted carpets had jumped to 48.5 million square metres in 1996 from 18.6 million in 1996.
Consolidated turnover has risen to 8.2 billion francs from 3.7 billion. Net current cash flow was about 550 million francs in 1996.
